ground_truth: Forrest stands next to George Wallace and listens as some Alabama policemen and citizens clap their hands while National Guardsmen stand at attention with their weapons in front of them. Forrest walks through the crowd, noticing two black students being led toward the schoolhouse. The young black girl drops one of her books, and Forrest steps past the policeman to pick up the book from the ground. He steps out from the crowd and brings the book up to the girl. A coach looks at the television, where Forrest is seen standing at the schoolhouse door. He looks around and waves as an assistant coach looks at the television and then at the other coaches. The football coach and two assistant coaches look as Forrest dries himself off with a towel after stepping from the showers. In color footage, Governor Wallace is mingling in a crowd when gunshots are fired, wounding him. Some men wrestle the shooter as Wallace lies wounded on the ground. Forrest sits on a bench as a black woman looks at him, with a white woman and a baby sitting to the left. A bus pulls up to the bus stop, and the black woman looks at her watch, then gets up and steps over to the bus. The white woman sits closer to Forrest. Later, Forrest sits outside Jenny's dorm in the rain holding a box of chocolates, looking at a car that pulls up as a song plays on the radio. Inside the car, Jenny is with a boy, leaning back against the passenger side door as they struggle to get comfortable. Billy gets back in the car and pulls away as Jenny steps toward Forrest. Forrest holds out the box of chocolates, and Jenny grabs his hand, leading him toward the dorm. They sneak to Jenny's door, unlock it, and step inside. Jenny pulls a robe off her sleeping roommate's bed and hands it to Forrest, who sits on Jenny's bed. She picks up a towel and walks back toward Forrest, drying the water from her hair. She takes off her slip and sits on the bed next to Forrest, wearing only her bra and panties. Forrest looks at Jenny as if he's never seen a woman in her underwear before and looks down at her breasts. Jenny realizes he is looking at her, leans over, and puts her head on his shoulder as a song comes over the radio. Jenny hugs Forrest, laughs, and kisses him on the cheek. They hug on the bed, while Jenny's roommate pretends to be asleep but listens, horrified, with her eyes open.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Forrest stands adjacent to George Wallace and hears as some Alabama officers and civilians applaud their hands while National Guardsmen stand at attention with their arms in front of them. Forrest strolls through the throng, observing two black pupils being guided toward the schoolhouse. The young black girl drops one of her volumes, and Forrest steps past the officer to lift the volume from the ground. He steps out from the throng and brings the volume up to the girl. A trainer looks at the television, where Forrest is seen standing at the schoolhouse entrance. He looks around and waves as an aide trainer looks at the television and then at the other trainers. The football trainer and two aide trainers look as Forrest dries himself off with a cloth after stepping from the showers. In color footage, Governor Wallace is mingling in a throng when gunshots are discharged, injuring him. Some men grapple the assailant as Wallace lies injured on the ground. Forrest sits on a bench as a black lady looks at him, with a white lady and an infant sitting to the left. A bus draws up to the bus stop, and the black lady looks at her timepiece, then gets up and steps over to the bus. The white lady sits nearer to Forrest. Later, Forrest sits outside Jenny's dormitory in the rain clutching a box of candies, looking at a vehicle that draws up as a melody plays on the radio. Inside the vehicle, Jenny is with a boy, reclining back against the passenger side door as they struggle to get comfortable. Billy gets back in the vehicle and draws away as Jenny steps toward Forrest. Forrest holds out the box of candies, and Jenny seizes his hand, directing him toward the dormitory. They sneak to Jenny's door, unlock it, and step inside. Jenny pulls a robe off her slumbering roommate's bed and hands it to Forrest, who sits on Jenny's bed. She picks up a cloth and walks back toward Forrest, drying the water from her hair. She removes her slip and sits on the bed next to Forrest, wearing only her brassiere and panties. Forrest looks at Jenny as if he's never seen a lady in her undergarments before and looks down at her bosom. Jenny realizes he is looking at her, leans over, and puts her head on his shoulder as a melody comes over the radio. Jenny embraces Forrest, laughs, and kisses him on the cheek. They embrace on the bed, while Jenny's roommate feigns to be asleep but listens, horrified, with her eyes open.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Forrest stands beside George Wallace, observing Alabama policemen and citizens clapping while National Guardsmen stand armed. He walks through the crowd and sees two black students heading to the schoolhouse. A black girl drops her book, and Forrest picks it up, handing it to her. A coach watches Forrest on TV at the schoolhouse door. The football coach and assistants see Forrest drying off with a towel after a shower. Governor Wallace mingles with a crowd when gunshots wound him, and men subdue the shooter. Forrest sits on a bench beside a black woman, with a white woman and baby nearby. A bus arrives, and the black woman leaves, while the white woman sits closer to Forrest. Forrest later waits outside Jenny's dorm in the rain with chocolates, watching Jenny with a boy in a car. The boy drives off, and Jenny approaches Forrest, who offers the chocolates. Jenny takes his hand, leading him to her dorm. Inside, Jenny hands Forrest a robe and dries her hair. She removes her slip, sitting beside Forrest in her underwear. Forrest gazes at Jenny in awe, looking at her breasts. Jenny notices, rests her head on his shoulder, and embraces him as a song plays. They hug on the bed, while Jenny's roommate listens, feigning sleep, horrified.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Forrest stands with George Wallace as police and citizens clap, while National Guardsmen stand ready. Forrest notices two black students heading to the schoolhouse, and when a young girl drops her book, he retrieves it. A coach sees Forrest on TV at the schoolhouse and looks around, while assistant coaches watch Forrest dry off post-shower. In color footage, gunshots wound Governor Wallace as the shooter is subdued. Forrest sits on a bench with a black and a white woman with a baby. As a bus arrives, the black woman checks her watch, boards, and the white woman moves closer to Forrest. Later, in the rain, Forrest holds chocolates outside Jenny's dorm as Jenny and a boy shuffle in a car. Jenny exits and leads Forrest inside with chocolates. They sneak to Jenny's room, where she gives Forrest a robe from her sleeping roommate's bed. She dries her hair, removes her slip, and sits in her underwear beside Forrest. He looks at Jenny's body, and she rests her head on his shoulder, hugging and kissing him. They embrace on the bed as Jenny's roommate listens, eyes open in astonishment.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Forrest stands next to George Wallace and attentively listens as a number of Alabama policemen and local citizens clamorously clap their hands, while a group of National Guardsmen stand stoically at attention, their weapons held firmly in front of them. Forrest weaves his way through the gathered crowd, observing with curiosity as two black students are ceremoniously led toward the imposing schoolhouse. Noticing a young black girl inadvertently drop one of her books, Forrest steps assertively past the unmoving policeman to retrieve the book from the ground with a gentle motion. He then steps confidently out from the throng of people and hands the recovered book up to the grateful girl. Meanwhile, a coach observes the television screen, where Forrest is clearly visible standing prominently at the schoolhouse door. The coach looks around the room and waves amicably, while an assistant coach glances with noticeable interest at the television and then at the other coaches in the room. The football coach, along with two assistant coaches, observes as Forrest dries himself off with a towel after emerging from the showers. In vivid color footage, Governor Wallace is seen mingling within a large crowd when the sudden sound of gunshots is heard, leaving him wounded. Several men spring into action and wrestle the shooter to the ground as Wallace lies injured. Later, Forrest is seated on a bench as a black woman casts a glance at him, with a white woman and her baby positioned to his left. A bus arrives at the bustling bus stop, prompting the black woman to check her watch and then rise from her seat to board the bus. The white woman subtly shifts closer to Forrest. Subsequently, Forrest sits patiently outside Jenny's dormitory in the falling rain, clutching a neatly wrapped box of chocolates, while staring intently at a car that slowly pulls up, accompanied by a song playing softly on the radio. Inside the car, Jenny is seen with a boy, both awkwardly struggling to find comfort as she leans back against the passenger side door. Billy returns to the car and quickly drives away as Jenny approaches Forrest with measured steps. Forrest offers the box of chocolates to Jenny, who warmly takes his hand and leads him towards the dormitory. Together, they quietly sneak to Jenny's door, unlock it, and discreetly slip inside. Jenny then removes a robe from her sleeping roommate’s bed, graciously handing it to Forrest, who takes a seat on Jenny's bed. She picks up a towel and walks back towards Forrest, gently drying the water from her hair. Removing her slip, she then sits on the bed beside Forrest, clad only in her bra and panties. Forrest gazes at Jenny with an expression of awe, as if he has never before seen a woman in her underwear, his eyes lowering to her breasts. Realizing his gaze, Jenny leans over, resting her head affectionately on his shoulder as a song softly plays over the radio. Jenny embraces Forrest, laughing lightly, and plants a tender kiss on his cheek. They share a close embrace on the bed, while Jenny’s roommate, feigning sleep, listens with horror, her eyes wide open.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Forrest stands quietly beside George Wallace, listening intently as a number of Alabama policemen and local citizens applauding with an enthusiastic fervor. Meanwhile, a group of National Guardsmen remain standing stoically at attention, their weapons held firmly in front of them as if on display. With a sense of curiosity, Forrest weaves his way through the gathered crowd, observing carefully as two black students are ceremoniously escorted toward the imposing schoolhouse entrance. As he watches, a young black girl inadvertently drops one of her books. Noticing this, Forrest steps assertively past the seemingly immovable policeman to gently retrieve the book from the ground. He then steps confidently out from the throng of people and hands the recovered book up to the grateful girl, who receives it with a thankful expression. 

Meanwhile, back at another location, a coach observes the television screen with interest, where Forrest can be seen clearly, standing prominently at the schoolhouse door. The coach, looking around the room, waves amicably, while one of his assistant coaches glances with noticeable interest back and forth between the television and the other coaches gathered in the room. Together, the football coach and his two assistant coaches watch with curiosity as Forrest dries himself off using a towel after emerging from the showers. 

In vivid color footage, Governor Wallace is depicted mingling within a large crowd when suddenly, the sharp sound of gunshots is heard, leaving him wounded on the ground. In response, several men spring into action, quickly wrestling the shooter to the ground as Wallace lies injured. 

Later, Forrest is seated calmly on a bench as a black woman sitting nearby casts a fleeting glance at him, with a white woman and her baby positioned to his left. A bus arrives at the bustling bus stop, prompting the black woman to check her watch before rising from her seat to board it. The white woman then subtly shifts closer to Forrest on the bench. 

Subsequently, Forrest sits patiently outside Jenny's dormitory, with rain steadily falling around him. He clutches a neatly wrapped box of chocolates and stares intently at a car that slowly pulls up, accompanied by a song playing softly on the radio. Inside the car, Jenny is seen with a boy, both awkwardly struggling to find comfort as she leans back against the passenger-side door. Billy returns to the car, quickly driving away as Jenny approaches Forrest with measured steps. Forrest offers her the box of chocolates, which Jenny accepts warmly before taking his hand and leading him toward the dormitory. Together, they quietly sneak to Jenny's door, unlock it, and discreetly slip inside. 

Once inside, Jenny removes a robe from her sleeping roommate’s bed, graciously handing it to Forrest, who takes a grateful seat on Jenny's bed. She picks up a towel and walks back towards Forrest, gently drying the water from her hair. After removing her slip, she sits on the bed beside Forrest, now clad only in her bra and panties. Forrest gazes at Jenny with an expression of awe, as if he has never before seen a woman in her underwear, his eyes drawn down to her breasts. Realizing the focus of his gaze, Jenny leans over and rests her head affectionately on his shoulder as a song plays softly over the radio. Jenny embraces Forrest, laughing lightly, and plants a tender kiss on his cheek. They share a close embrace on the bed, all the while Jenny’s roommate, pretending to be asleep, listens with horror, her eyes wide open.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Forrest stands attentively next to George Wallace, taking in the scene as a group of Alabama policemen and citizens clap their hands in support, while nearby National Guardsmen remain at attention, their weapons held firmly in front of them. As Forrest begins to move through the gathered crowd, his eyes catch sight of two black students being guided towards the schoolhouse. Suddenly, the young black girl inadvertently drops one of her books. Observing this, Forrest makes his way past a nearby policeman, reaches down to retrieve the fallen book from the ground, holds it securely in his hands, and steps forward from the throng. He then approaches the girl, extending the book toward her to return it. Meanwhile, a coach is engrossed in watching the television, where the image of Forrest standing at the schoolhouse door is clearly visible. Forrest, sensing the attention, glances around momentarily before offering a friendly wave, catching the eye of an assistant coach who looks from the television to his fellow coaches. Transitioning to another scene, the football coach, accompanied by two assistant coaches, observe Forrest in the locker room as he methodically dries himself off with a towel, having just stepped out from the showers. The narrative shifts to color footage, portraying Governor Wallace amidst a crowd when the sudden sound of gunshots rings out, leaving him wounded. Chaos ensues as several men wrestle the shooter to the ground while Wallace lies injured nearby. Forrest is then seen sitting quietly on a bench. A black woman stands by, casting a glance in his direction, with a white woman and her baby seated to the left of him. At that moment, a bus pulls up to the bus stop, prompting the black woman to check her watch before rising from her seat and making her way to the bus. The white woman seizes the opportunity to move closer to Forrest. Time passes, and Forrest finds himself outside Jenny's dormitory, seated in the pouring rain and holding a box of chocolates. His gaze fixes on a car pulling up to the curb, accompanied by a song playing softly on the radio. Inside, Jenny is with a boy, leaning back against the door on the passenger side as they awkwardly attempt to find a comfortable position. Billy returns to the driver’s seat and drives away, leaving Jenny to step out and approach Forrest. He presents her with the box of chocolates, and Jenny responds by grabbing his hand, gently leading him toward her dorm. They stealthily make their way to Jenny's door, quietly unlocking and entering the room. Inside, the dim light casts a soft glow as Jenny removes a robe from her sleeping roommate's bed, handing it to Forrest, who sits down on her bed. She retrieves a towel and moves back towards him, using it to dry her damp hair. In a moment of intimacy, she removes her slip and takes a seat next to Forrest on the bed, now dressed only in her bra and panties. Forrest looks at Jenny with a mixture of awe and innocence, as if he's never seen a woman in her undergarments before, his gaze lingering on her chest. Jenny notices his gaze, gently leans over, and rests her head on his shoulder as a tender song begins to play over the radio. She wraps her arms around Forrest, laughing softly, before planting a gentle kiss on his cheek. As they embrace on the bed, Jenny's roommate, though pretending to be asleep, lies with her eyes wide open, listening in silent disbelief.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Forrest stands beside George Wallace, observing the scene as policemen and citizens applaud, while National Guardsmen stand at attention. He moves through the crowd and notices two black students approaching the schoolhouse, picking up a book dropped by the young black girl and returning it to her. A coach sees Forrest on television at the schoolhouse door, waves, and shares a look with an assistant coach. Later, the coaches watch Forrest drying off after a shower. In color footage, gunshots erupt as Governor Wallace mingles with a crowd, leaving him wounded while bystanders tackle the shooter. Forrest sits on a bench next to a white woman and baby, as a black woman near them boards a bus, prompting the white woman to move closer to Forrest. Subsequently, Forrest waits outside Jenny's dorm in the rain, offering her a box of chocolates as Jenny approaches after a boy departs. Jenny takes Forrest's hand, leading him inside. They quietly enter her room, where she gives him a robe and sits beside him on her bed after drying her hair. Wearing only her bra and panties, Jenny notices Forrest's intrigued gaze. She leans her head on his shoulder as music plays, then hugs and kisses him. Meanwhile, Jenny's roommate feigns sleep but listens intently, her eyes wide open.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Forrest stands next to George Wallace, the controversial Alabama governor known for his pro-segregation stance during the 1960s, and listens as some Alabama policemen and citizens clap their hands while National Guardsmen, deployed to enforce school integration, stand at attention with their weapons in front of them. Forrest walks through the crowd, noticing two black students courageously being led toward the schoolhouse in a scene reflecting the tense desegregation efforts of the era. The young black girl drops one of her books, and Forrest, showing a simple act of kindness amid the hostility, steps past the policeman to pick up the book from the ground. He steps out from the crowd and brings the book up to the girl, reminiscent of the small but meaningful gestures that were pivotal during the civil rights movement. A coach looks at the television, broadcasting the historic event, where Forrest is seen standing at the schoolhouse door. He looks around and waves as an assistant coach looks at the television and then at the other coaches, reflecting the widespread attention these events garnered across the nation. The football coach and two assistant coaches look as Forrest dries himself off with a towel after stepping from the showers, possibly indicating his routine after training sessions. In color footage, Governor Wallace is mingling in a crowd during a campaign rally when gunshots, in a shocking assassination attempt, are fired, wounding him. Some men wrestle the shooter as Wallace lies wounded on the ground, an event that significantly altered his political career. Forrest sits on a bench as a black woman, indicating the changing dynamics in Southern society, looks at him, with a white woman and a baby sitting to the left. A bus pulls up to the bus stop, part of the newly integrated public transport system, and the black woman looks at her watch, then gets up and steps over to the bus. The white woman sits closer to Forrest, suggesting the evolving social relations of the time. Later, Forrest sits outside Jenny's dorm in the rain, holding a box of chocolates, a gesture symbolizing affection, looking at a car that pulls up as a song by The Beatles plays on the radio, capturing the spirit of the 1960s. Inside the car, Jenny is with a boy, leaning back against the passenger side door as they struggle to get comfortable, a scene echoing youthful romances of the era. Billy gets back in the car and pulls away as Jenny steps toward Forrest. Forrest holds out the box of chocolates, and Jenny grabs his hand, leading him toward the dorm. They sneak to Jenny's door, unlock it, and step inside. Jenny pulls a robe off her sleeping roommate's bed and hands it to Forrest, who sits on Jenny's bed. She picks up a towel and walks back toward Forrest, drying the water from her hair, as the dorms provided limited privacy. She takes off her slip and sits on the bed next to Forrest, wearing only her bra and panties, a more liberated fashion choice of the time. Forrest looks at Jenny as if he's never seen a woman in her underwear before and looks down at her breasts. Jenny realizes he is looking at her, leans over, and puts her head on his shoulder as a song by Simon & Garfunkel comes over the radio, setting a tender mood. Jenny hugs Forrest, laughs, and kisses him on the cheek. They hug on the bed, while Jenny's roommate pretends to be asleep but listens, horrified, with her eyes open, illustrating the social boundaries being tested in the changing cultural climate.

Forrest holds out the box of chocolates and Jenny grabs his hand leading him toward the dorm. They sneak to Jenny's door unlock it and step inside. They hug on the bed while Jenny's roommate pretends to be asleep but listens horrified with her eyes open.

During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. Later Forrest sits outside Jenny's dorm in the rain holding a box of chocolates looking at a car that pulls up as a song plays on the radio. Inside the car Jenny is with a boy leaning back against the passenger side door as they struggle to get comfortable. Billy gets back in the car and pulls away as Jenny steps toward Forrest. Forrest holds out the box of chocolates and Jenny grabs his hand leading him toward the dorm. They sneak to Jenny's door unlock it and step inside. Jenny pulls a robe off her sleeping roommate's bed and hands it to Forrest who sits on Jenny's bed. She picks up a towel and walks back toward Forrest drying the water from her hair. She takes off her slip and sits on the bed next to Forrest wearing only her bra and panties. Forrest looks at Jenny as if he is never seen a woman in her underwear before and looks down at her breasts. Jenny realizes he is looking at her leans over and puts her head on his shoulder. as a song comes over the radio. Jenny hugs. Forrest laughs and kisses him on the cheek. They hug on the bed while Jenny's roommate pretends to be asleep but listens horrified with her eyes open.

test_cases.name: Deletion (~50%)
test_cases.description: Forrest stands next to George Wallace and listens as some Alabama policemen and citizens clap their hands while National Guardsmen stand at attention with their weapons in front of them. Forrest walks through the crowd noticing two black students being led toward the schoolhouse. The young black girl drops one of her books and Forrest steps past the policeman to pick up the book from the ground. He steps out from the crowd and brings the book up to the girl. A coach looks at the television where Forrest is seen standing at the schoolhouse door. He looks around and waves as an assistant coach looks at the television and then at the other coaches. The football coach and two assistant coaches look as Forrest dries himself off with a towel after stepping from the showers. She takes off her slip and sits on the bed next to Forrest wearing only her bra and panties. Forrest looks at Jenny as if he is never seen a woman in her underwear before and looks down at her breasts. Jenny realizes he is looking at her leans over and puts her head on his shoulder. as a song comes over the radio. Jenny hugs. Forrest laughs and kisses him on the cheek. They hug on the bed while Jenny's roommate pretends to be asleep but listens horrified with her eyes open.

test_cases.description: Forrest stands next to George Wallace and listens as some Alabama policemen and citizens clap their hands while National Guardsmen stand at attention with their weapons in front of them. Forrest walks through the crowd noticing two black students being led toward the schoolhouse. The young black girl drops one of her books and Forrest steps past the policeman to pick up the book from the ground. Jenny hugs. Forrest laughs and kisses him on the cheek. They hug on the bed while Jenny's roommate pretends to be asleep but listens horrified with her eyes open.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: Forrest Gump stands next to an astronaut and listens as some Alabama policemen and citizens clap their hands while National Guardsmen stand at attention with their weapons in front of them. A rabbit walks through the crowd, noticing two black students being led toward the schoolhouse. The young black girl drops one of her books, and the rabbit steps past the policeman to pick up the book from the ground. The rabbit steps out from the crowd and brings the book up to the girl. A penguin looks at the television, where the rabbit is seen standing at the schoolhouse door. The penguin looks around and waves as a lion looks at the television and then at the other penguins. The football player and two assistant players look as the rabbit dries itself off with a towel after stepping from the showers. In color footage, a celebrity is mingling in a crowd when gunshots are fired, wounding the celebrity. Some penguins wrestle the shooter as the celebrity lies wounded on the ground. An owl sits on a bench as a black woman looks at the owl, with a white woman and a baby sitting to the left. A bus pulls up to the bus stop, and the black woman looks at her watch, then gets up and steps over to the bus. The white woman sits closer to the owl. Later, the owl sits outside Jenny's dorm in the rain holding a box of chocolates, looking at a car that pulls up as a song plays on the radio. Inside the car, Jenny is with an elephant, leaning back against the passenger side door as they struggle to get comfortable. A giraffe gets back in the car and pulls away as Jenny steps toward the owl. The owl holds out the box of chocolates, and Jenny grabs its hand, leading the owl toward the dorm. They sneak to Jenny's door, unlock it, and step inside. Jenny pulls a robe off her sleeping roommate's bed and hands it to the owl, who sits on Jenny's bed. She picks up a towel and walks back toward the owl, drying the water from her hair. She takes off a slip and sits on the bed next to the owl, wearing only her bra and panties. The owl looks at Jenny as if it's never seen a woman in her underwear before and looks down at her breasts. Jenny realizes the owl is looking at her, leans over, and puts her head on its shoulder as a song comes over the radio. Jenny hugs the owl, laughs, and kisses it on the cheek. They hug on the bed, while Jenny's roommate pretends to be asleep but listens, horrified, with her eyes open.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Forrest stands next to George Wallace and listens as some Alabama firefighters and citizens snap their fingers while National Park Rangers stand at attention with their flutes in front of them. Forrest walks through the gathering, noticing two black students being led toward the bakery. The young black girl drops one of her dolls, and Forrest steps past the firefighter to pick up the doll from the ground. He steps out from the gathering and brings the doll up to the girl. A chef looks at the computer screen, where Forrest is seen standing at the bakery door. He looks around and waves as a sous-chef looks at the computer screen and then at the other chefs. The head chef and two sous-chefs look as Forrest dries himself off with an apron after stepping from the rain. In color footage, Governor Wallace is mingling in a crowd when fireworks are launched, startling him. Some folks tackle the prankster as Wallace lies shocked on the ground. Forrest sits on a swing as a black woman looks at him, with a white woman and a toddler sitting to the left. A train pulls up to the train station, and the black woman looks at her phone, then gets up and steps over to the train. The white woman sits closer to Forrest. Later, Forrest sits outside Jenny's dorm in the drizzle holding a box of cookies, looking at a scooter that pulls up as a melody plays on the harmonica. Inside the scooter, Jenny is with a boy, leaning back against the passenger side door as they struggle to get comfortable. Billy gets back on the scooter and rides away as Jenny steps toward Forrest. Forrest holds out the box of cookies, and Jenny grabs his hand, leading him toward the dorm. They sneak to Jenny's door, unlock it, and step inside. Jenny pulls a scarf off her sleeping roommate's bed and hands it to Forrest, who sits on Jenny's bed. She picks up a sponge and walks back toward Forrest, drying the water from her hair. She takes off her cardigan and sits on the bed next to Forrest, wearing only her bra and panties. Forrest looks at Jenny as if he's never seen a woman in her undergarments before and looks down at her knees. Jenny realizes he is looking at her, leans over, and puts her head on his shoulder as a melody comes over the harmonica. Jenny hugs Forrest, laughs, and kisses him on the cheek. They hug on the bed, while Jenny's roommate pretends to be asleep but listens, horrified, with her eyes open.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Forrest lounges next to George Wallace and observes as some Alabama policemen and citizens stomp their feet while National Guardsmen lean at ease with their weapons in front of them. Forrest skips through the crowd, noticing two black students being escorted away from the schoolhouse. The young black girl tosses one of her books, and Forrest glides past the policeman to retrieve the book from the ground. He dances out from the crowd and hands the book up to the girl. A coach glances at the television, where Forrest is seen skipping at the schoolhouse door. He whistles around and claps as an assistant coach glances at the television and then at the other coaches. The football coach and two assistant coaches glance as Forrest dresses himself with a jacket after jumping from the showers. In color footage, Governor Wallace is mingling in a crowd when fireworks are launched, wounding him. Some men celebrate with the shooter as Wallace lies untouched on the ground. Forrest sprawls on a bench as a black woman smiles at him, with a white woman and a baby lounging to the left. A bus zooms up to the bus stop, and the black woman checks her watch, then gets up and dances over to the bus. The white woman scoots closer to Forrest. Later, Forrest strolls outside Jenny's dorm in the rain holding a box of chocolates, glancing at a car that zooms up as a song plays on the radio. Inside the car, Jenny is with a boy, lounging against the passenger side door as they shift to get comfortable. Billy leaps back in the car and speeds away as Jenny skips toward Forrest. Forrest raises the box of chocolates, and Jenny nudges his hand, guiding him toward the dorm. They tiptoe to Jenny's door, lock it, and skip inside. Jenny grabs a robe off her sleeping roommate's bed and tosses it to Forrest, who sprawls on Jenny's bed. She picks up a towel and strolls back toward Forrest, brushing the water from her hair. She slips off her scarf and sprawls on the bed next to Forrest, wearing only her bra and panties. Forrest stares at Jenny as if he's never seen a woman in her underwear before and glances down at her breasts. Jenny realizes he is staring at her, leans over, and places her head on his shoulder as a song echoes over the radio. Jenny nudges Forrest, giggles, and pecks him on the cheek. They snuggle on the bed, while Jenny's roommate fakes being asleep but listens, shocked, with her eyes wide open.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Waldo stands next to Captain Nemo and listens as some Icelandic chefs and tourists clap their hands while Arctic Explorers stand at attention with their maps in front of them. Waldo walks through the market, noticing two orange cats being led toward the treehouse. The young orange kitten drops one of her apples, and Waldo steps past the chef to pick up the apple from the gravel. He steps out from the market and brings the apple up to the kitten. A magician looks at the telescope, where Waldo is seen standing at the treehouse gate. He looks around and waves as an assistant magician looks at the telescope and then at the other magicians. The circus clown and two assistant clowns look as Waldo dries himself off with a leaf after stepping from the fountain. In color footage, Captain Nemo is mingling in a market when fireworks are launched, wounding him. Some sailors wrestle the pyrotechnician as Nemo lies wounded on the gravel. Waldo sits on a hammock as a green alien looks at him, with a red alien and a puppy sitting to the left. A train pulls up to the train station, and the green alien looks at her calendar, then gets up and steps over to the train. The red alien sits closer to Waldo. Later, Waldo sits outside Daphne's loft in the sunshine holding a bunch of bananas, looking at a truck that pulls up as a tune plays on the phonograph. Inside the truck, Daphne is with a robot, leaning back against the driver side door as they struggle to get comfortable. Phil gets back in the truck and pulls away as Daphne steps toward Waldo. Waldo holds out the bunch of bananas, and Daphne grabs his elbow, leading him toward the loft. They sneak to Daphne's gate, unlock it, and step inside. Daphne pulls a scarf off her sleeping ninja's rug and hands it to Waldo, who sits on Daphne's hammock. She picks up a brush and walks back toward Waldo, drying the dust from her ears. She takes off her hat and sits on the hammock next to Waldo, wearing only her socks and scarf. Waldo looks at Daphne as if he's never seen a person in her socks before and looks down at her feet. Daphne realizes he is looking at her, leans over, and puts her head on his elbow as a tune comes over the phonograph. Daphne hugs Waldo, laughs, and kisses him on the knee. They hug on the hammock, while Daphne's ninja pretends to be asleep but listens, horrified, with his ears open.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Evan stands next to Governor Mitchell and observes as some Mississippi firemen and tourists stomp their feet while local soldiers kneel with their helmets in front of them. Evan drifts through the audience, noticing two Hispanic artists being escorted toward the library. The young Hispanic boy drops one of his hats, and Evan slips past the fireman to retrieve the hat from the ground. He slips out from the audience and presents the hat up to the boy. A teacher glances at the computer, where Evan is seen lounging at the library gate. He glances around and nods as a student teacher glances at the computer and then at the other teachers. The swim coach and two gym teachers glance as Evan brushes himself off with a jacket after lounging in the pool. In black-and-white footage, Governor Mitchell is engaging in a picnic when fireworks are ignited, alarming him. Some women seize the firestarter as Mitchell stands shocked on the lawn. Evan reclines on a lawn chair as a Hispanic man observes him, with an Asian man and a dog positioned to the left. A taxi arrives at the taxi stand, and the Hispanic man checks his phone, then rises and marches over to the taxi. The Asian man scoots closer to Evan. Later, Evan reclines outside Laura's apartment in the sunshine holding a bouquet of tulips, watching a bicycle that rolls up as a tune echoes from the speakers. On the bike, Laura is with a girl, sitting up against the rear wheel as they attempt to find balance. Charlie hops back on the bike and rides away as Laura glides toward Evan. Evan holds out the bouquet of tulips, and Laura shakes his wrist, guiding him toward the apartment. They tiptoe to Laura's kitchen, unbolt it, and glide inside. Laura lifts a scarf off her resting friend's chair and offers it to Evan, who reclines on Laura's couch. She grabs a sweater and strolls back toward Evan, wiping the dust from her shoes. She removes her sweater and reclines on the couch beside Evan, adorned only in her tank top and shorts. Evan glances at Laura as if he's never noticed a woman in her casual wear before and glances down at her legs. Laura realizes he is glancing at her, leans over, and rests her chin on his arm as a melody plays over the speakers. Laura squeezes Evan, grins, and brushes his cheek with her hand. They embrace on the couch, while Laura's friend pretends to be reading but eavesdrops, astonished, with her eyes wide open.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Forrest stands beside George Wallace and observes as some Alabama lifeguards and townspeople stomp their feet while National Guardsmen crouch low with their shields beside them. Forrest glides through the assembly, noticing two black students being chased away from the carousel. The young black girl drops one of her hats, and Forrest skips past the lifeguard to retrieve the hat from the pavement. He dances out from the throng and tosses the hat up to the girl. A cook glances at the movie screen, where Forrest is seen twirling at the carousel entrance. He peers around and claps as a sous-chef glances at the screen and then at the other cooks. The chef and two sous-chefs watch as Forrest shakes himself like a dog with a blanket after climbing out of a swimming pool. In color footage, Governor Wallace is mingling in a carnival when fireworks are set off, startling him. Some clowns chase the firework launcher as Wallace sits surprised on the ride. Forrest perches on a rock as a black woman stares at him, with a white woman and a kitten sitting to the left. A train rolls up to the station, and the black woman checks her mirror, then gets up and strolls over to the train. The white woman inches nearer to Forrest. Later, Forrest sits outside Jenny's treehouse in the mist holding a bouquet, eyeing a trolley that rolls up as a band plays on the stereo. Inside the trolley, Jenny is with a boy, leaning back against the window as they try to sit comfortably. Billy climbs back on the trolley and rides away as Jenny steps toward Forrest. Forrest offers up the bouquet, and Jenny grasps his elbow, pulling him toward the treehouse. They tiptoe to Jenny's window, unlock it, and slip inside. Jenny takes a hat from her sleeping roommate's chair and hands it to Forrest, who settles on Jenny's chair. She picks up a fan and walks back toward Forrest, cooling the warmth from her face. She takes off a scarf and sits beside Forrest, wearing only her shirt and shorts. Forrest gawks at Jenny as if he’s never seen a woman in her summer clothes before and glances down at her knees. Jenny notices he is staring at her, leans over, and rests her head on his elbow as a band plays over the stereo. Jenny squeezes Forrest, chuckles, and pecks him on the forehead. They snuggle on the chair, while Jenny's roommate feigns sleep but eavesdrops, worried, with her eyes wide open.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Clifford squats beside Margaret Thompson and overhears as some Minnesota firefighters and tourists snap their fingers while Space Cadets sit at ease with their guitars beside them. Clifford hops through the parade, observing two green turtles being carried toward the clubhouse. The tiny green turtle spills one of its marbles, and Clifford skips beyond the firefighter to scoop the marble from the pavement. He bounces out from the parade and raises the marble up to the turtle. A gardener peers at the billboard, where Clifford is spotted lounging at the clubhouse entrance. He glances around and whistles as an apprentice gardener glances at the billboard and then at the other gardeners. The hockey gardener and three apprentice gardeners peek as Clifford braids himself with a ribbon after leaping from the hammocks. In sepia footage, Mayor Thompson is dancing in a parade when firecrackers are launched, tickling her. Several robots paint the launcher as Thompson giggles tickled on the pavement. Clifford lounges on a tree stump as a rainbow tiger peers at him, with a spotted dog and a kitten perched to the right. A train glides up to the station, and the rainbow tiger glances at its compass, then bounds up and hops over to the train. The spotted dog cuddles nearer to Clifford. Eventually, Clifford lounges beneath Mary's gazebo in the snow clutching a basket of strawberries, peering at a bicycle that glides up as a ballad plays through the megaphone. Inside the bicycle, Mary is with a wolf, leaning forward against the dashboard as they juggle to get cozy. Sammy gets out of the bicycle and glides away as Mary bounces toward Clifford. Clifford holds out the basket of strawberries, and Mary takes his elbow, guiding him toward the gazebo. They tiptoe to Mary's window, unlatch it, and glide inside. Mary takes a jacket off her dozing neighbor's sofa and hands it to Clifford, who lounges on Mary's sofa. She picks up a blanket and skips back toward Clifford, patting the mist from her paws. She pulls off her skirt and lounges on the sofa beside Clifford, sporting only her vest and shorts. Clifford peers at Mary as though he's never gazed upon a cat in her shorts previously and peers down at her whiskers. Mary realizes he is gazing at her, tilts over, and places her paw on his shoulder as a tune floats over the megaphone. Mary embraces Clifford, chuckles, and pecks him on the nose. They embrace on the sofa, while Mary's neighbor feigns sleep but eavesdrops, baffled, with her eyes agape.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Forrest observes George Wallace amidst clapping Alabama policemen and poised National Guardsmen. He picks up a book for a black girl heading to school, capturing the attention of a coach watching TV. Later, Governor Wallace is shot, and Forrest is seated with a black woman at a bus stop. As she boards a bus, a white woman moves closer to him. Forrest waits outside Jenny's dorm in the rain with chocolates. When Jenny arrives, she leads him to her room, where she dries off and sits beside him in her underwear. Forrest, seemingly inexperienced, gazes at her, leading Jenny to lean on his shoulder. They embrace as a song plays, with Jenny's roommate feigning sleep but listening in shock.
